means: （使）下沉， （使）沉没( sink的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Far off to the west the sun was sinking.
"Don't you understand?" I moaned, sinking dramatically to my knees.
sentence.Network_cn: “难道你不懂吗？”我呻吟着，猛然跪倒在地。

sentence.Network_en: The lifeboat crashed against the side of the sinking ship.
sentence.Network_cn: 救生船撞上了那艘正在下沉的船的侧身。

entry.tran: (情绪突然)颓丧的，抑郁的，沮丧的
entry.def: If you have a sinking feeling, you suddenly become depressed or lose hope.

example.ex: I began to have a sinking feeling that I was not going to get rid of her.
example.tran: 我开始有一种永远也摆脱不了她的沮丧情绪。

means.word_mean: 1. a descent as through liquid (especially through water);

sentences.sentence: "they still talk about the sinking of the Titanic"

means.word_mean: 2. a slow fall or decline (as for lack of strength);

sentences.sentence: "after several hours of sinking an unexpected rally rescued the market"
"he could not control the sinking of his legs"

means.word_mean: 3. a feeling caused by uneasiness or apprehension;

sentences.sentence: "a sinking feeling in the pit of my stomach"
